intro: Zhukowskia, commonly known as the common morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in the morning and close in the afternoon. The plant is native to the Americas but has been naturalized in many parts of the world. Its vines can grow up to several meters long, often climbing or trailing along surfaces. Zhukowskia is known for its rapid growth and is cultivated for its ornamental value.
